intro: Psychotria mornicola, commonly known as the morning glory of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Psychotria mornicola is often found in shaded, moist environments such as cloud forests.
